request.description: Generated from cURL: curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/login/" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username": "testuser", "password": "testpassword"}'

Generated from cURL: curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/books/" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{"title": "Book Title", "author": "Author Name", "genre": "Fiction", "year_published": 2023, "summary": "Sample summary."}'

Generated from cURL: curl -X POST "http://localhost:8000/books/bulk" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d \'{
    "books": [
        {
            "title": "Dune",
            "author": "Frank Herbert",
            "genre": "Sci-Fi",
            "year_published": 1965,
            "summary": "A science fiction novel set in a distant future involving political intrigue and a struggle for control of the desert planet Arrakis."
        },
        {
            "title": "1984",
            "author": "George Orwell",
            "genre": "Dystopian",
            "year_published": 1949,
            "summary": "A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Hobbit",
            "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien",
            "genre": "Fantasy",
            "year_published": 1937,
            "summary": "A home-loving hobbit embarks on an adventure to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon."
        },
        {
            "title": "Pride and Prejudice",
            "author": "Jane Austen",
            "genre": "Romance",
            "year_published": 1813,
            "summary": "A romantic novel about the emotional development of Elizabeth Bennet."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Catcher in the Rye",
            "author": "J.D. Salinger",
            "genre": "Literary Fiction",
            "year_published": 1951,
            "summary": "A teenage boy's journey through New York after being expelled from his prep school."
        },
        {
            "title": "To Kill a Mockingbird",
            "author": "Harper Lee",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1960,
            "summary": "A young girl in the American South experiences the realities of racism and justice."
        },
        {
            "title": "Brave New World",
            "author": "Aldous Huxley",
            "genre": "Dystopian",
            "year_published": 1932,
            "summary": "A dystopian novel set in a future where people are controlled through pleasure and conditioning."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Da Vinci Code",
            "author": "Dan Brown",
            "genre": "Thriller",
            "year_published": 2003,
            "summary": "A symbologist and cryptologist uncover secrets protected since the time of Christ."
        },
        {
            "title": "Moby-Dick",
            "author": "Herman Melville",
            "genre": "Adventure",
            "year_published": 1851,
            "summary": "A sea captain obsessively pursues a white whale."
        },
        {
            "title": "War and Peace",
            "author": "Leo Tolstoy",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1869,
            "summary": "A sweeping novel about the lives of five aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars."
        },
        {
            "title": "Crime and Punishment",
            "author": "Fyodor Dostoevsky",
            "genre": "Psychological Fiction",
            "year_published": 1866,
            "summary": "A psychological drama about a man who commits murder and struggles with guilt."
        },
        {
            "title": "Frankenstein",
            "author": "Mary Shelley",
            "genre": "Gothic Fiction",
            "year_published": 1818,
            "summary": "A scientist creates a living being, only to be horrified by the result."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Great Gatsby",
            "author": "F. Scott Fitzgerald",
            "genre": "Literary Fiction",
            "year_published": 1925,
            "summary": "A mysterious millionaire throws lavish parties in the hopes of reuniting with his lost love."
        },
        {
            "title": "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer\\'s Stone",
            "author": "J.K. Rowling",
            "genre": "Fantasy",
            "year_published": 1997,
            "summary": "A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends a magical school."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Lord of the Rings",
            "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien",
            "genre": "Fantasy",
            "year_published": 1954,
            "summary": "A fellowship sets out on a quest to destroy a powerful ring."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Alchemist",
            "author": "Paulo Coelho",
            "genre": "Philosophical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1988,
            "summary": "A young shepherd sets out on a journey to find his personal legend."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Picture of Dorian Gray",
            "author": "Oscar Wilde",
            "genre": "Gothic Fiction",
            "year_published": 1890,
            "summary": "A young man remains youthful while his portrait ages and reveals his corruption."
        },
        {
            "title": "Dracula",
            "author": "Bram Stoker",
            "genre": "Horror",
            "year_published": 1897,
            "summary": "A group of people tries to stop a vampire lord from spreading his undead curse."
        },
        {
            "title": "Don Quixote",
            "author": "Miguel de Cervantes",
            "genre": "Adventure",
            "year_published": 1605,
            "summary": "A man becomes obsessed with chivalry and sets out to revive knighthood."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Road",
            "author": "Cormac McCarthy",
            "genre": "Post-Apocalyptic",
            "year_published": 2006,
            "summary": "A father and son struggle to survive in a post-apocalyptic world."
        },
        {
            "title": "Gone with the Wind",
            "author": "Margaret Mitchell",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1936,
            "summary": "A Southern woman faces hardship during the Civil War and Reconstruction."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Kite Runner",
            "author": "Khaled Hosseini",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 2003,
            "summary": "A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan\'s political turmoil."
        },
        {
            "title": "Fahrenheit 451",
            "author": "Ray Bradbury",
            "genre": "Dystopian",
            "year_published": 1953,
            "summary": "A fireman becomes disillusioned with his job of burning books in a future where they are banned."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Handmaid\\'s Tale",
            "author": "Margaret Atwood",
            "genre": "Dystopian",
            "year_published": 1985,
            "summary": "In a totalitarian society, women are treated as property and forced to bear children."
        },
        {
            "title": "Slaughterhouse-Five",
            "author": "Kurt Vonnegut",
            "genre": "Science Fiction",
            "year_published": 1969,
            "summary": "A soldier becomes unstuck in time after surviving the bombing of Dresden."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Catch-22",
            "author": "Joseph Heller",
            "genre": "Satire",
            "year_published": 1961,
            "summary": "A bomber pilot in World War II tries to escape the absurdity of war and bureaucracy."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Shining",
            "author": "Stephen King",
            "genre": "Horror",
            "year_published": 1977,
            "summary": "A family takes care of a remote hotel, and the father becomes possessed by dark forces."
        },
        {
            "title": "Jane Eyre",
            "author": "Charlotte Brontë",
            "genre": "Romance",
            "year_published": 1847,
            "summary": "An orphaned girl becomes a governess and falls in love with her mysterious employer."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Grapes of Wrath",
            "author": "John Steinbeck",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1939,
            "summary": "A poor family flees the Dust Bowl in search of a better life in California."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Count of Monte Cristo",
            "author": "Alexandre Dumas",
            "genre": "Adventure",
            "year_published": 1844,
            "summary": "A man escapes from prison and seeks revenge on those who betrayed him."
        },
        {
            "title": "A Tale of Two Cities",
            "author": "Charles Dickens",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1859,
            "summary": "A novel about the French Revolution and the contrasting lives of two men."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Stranger",
            "author": "Albert Camus",
            "genre": "Philosophical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1942,
            "summary": "A man becomes detached from society after committing a senseless murder."
        },
        {
            "title": "Beloved",
            "author": "Toni Morrison",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1987,
            "summary": "A former slave is haunted by the ghost of her daughter in post-Civil War America."
        },
        {
            "title": "Lolita",
            "author": "Vladimir Nabokov",
            "genre": "Literary Fiction",
            "year_published": 1955,
            "summary": "A middle-aged man becomes obsessed with a twelve-year-old girl."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Name of the Wind",
            "author": "Patrick Rothfuss",
            "genre": "Fantasy",
            "year_published": 2007,
            "summary": "A legendary hero recounts his life story in a world of magic and mystery."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo",
            "author": "Stieg Larsson",
            "genre": "Thriller",
            "year_published": 2005,
            "summary": "A journalist and a hacker investigate the disappearance of a wealthy heiress."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Hunger Games",
            "author": "Suzanne Collins",
            "genre": "Dystopian",
            "year_published": 2008,
            "summary": "A girl must compete in a deadly televised contest where only one person can survive."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Fault in Our Stars",
            "author": "John Green",
            "genre": "Romance",
            "year_published": 2012,
            "summary": "Two teenagers with terminal cancer form a life-changing bond."
        },
        {
            "title": "Ulysses",
            "author": "James Joyce",
            "genre": "Modernist Fiction",
            "year_published": 1922,
            "summary": "A day in the life of an ordinary man in Dublin, modeled after Homer\'s Odyssey."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Brothers Karamazov",
            "author": "Fyodor Dostoevsky",
            "genre": "Philosophical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1880,
            "summary": "A murder mystery that explores themes of faith, free will, and morality."
        },
        {
            "title": "Wuthering Heights",
            "author": "Emily Brontë",
            "genre": "Gothic Fiction",
            "year_published": 1847,
            "summary": "A tale of passionate love and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Odyssey",
            "author": "Homer",
            "genre": "Epic Poetry",
            "year_published": "8th Century BC",
            "summary": "The story of Odysseus\'s long journey home after the Trojan War."
        },
        {
            "title": "Les Misérables",
            "author": "Victor Hugo",
            "genre": "Historical Fiction",
            "year_published": 1862,
            "summary": "A man seeks redemption in post-revolutionary France while being pursued by a relentless policeman."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Secret History",
            "author": "Donna Tartt",
            "genre": "Thriller",
            "year_published": 1992,
            "summary": "A group of elite students at a private college become involved in a murder."
        },
        {
            "title": "The Stand",
            "author": "Stephen King",
            "genre": "Post-Apocalyptic",
            "year_published": 1978,
            "summary": "After a plague wipes out most of the population, the survivors must choose between good and evil."
        },
        {
            "title": "Anna Karenina",
            "author": "Leo Tolstoy",
            "genre": "Literary Fiction",
            "year_published": 1877,
            "summary": "A tragic story of love and infidelity among the Russian aristocracy."
        },
        {
            "title": "Rebecca",
            "author": "Daphne du Maurier",
            "genre": "Gothic Fiction",
            "year_published": 1938,
            "summary": "A young bride is haunted by the memory of her husband\'s first wife."
        }
    ]
}'

[
    {
        "id": 6,
